meanings.definition: Make (something or someone) sensitive to light, especially to ultraviolet radiation.
meanings.sent1: The doctor recommended photosensitizing the skin before the treatment.
meanings.sent2: She is photosensitizing the film to create a unique effect in her photography.
meanings.sent3: The scientist accidentally photosensitized the plant, making it glow in the dark!
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to photosensitize the canvas, bringing the colors to life.
meanings.sent5: The potion had a magical quality, as if it could photosensitize anything it touched.

meanings.definition: Causing a reaction in the skin when exposed to sunlight or ultraviolet light.
meanings.sent1: The photosensitizing lotion made her skin more prone to sunburn.
meanings.sent2: He always wears a hat to protect his photosensitizing skin from the sun.
meanings.sent3: The photosensitizing cream turned her face bright red after just a few minutes in the sun!
meanings.sent4: The photosensitizing reaction on his arms resembled a patchwork of red and white.
meanings.sent5: The photosensitizing effect of the medication made her avoid direct sunlight at all costs.
